channel.title: GhostMouse
channel.description:
this is a ghostmouse script
Records your mouse movements and clicks
then plays back the amount of times you want
i had to create my own variable type for this, its called TMouse :P
[size=12pt][b]DO NOT USE WITH RUNESCAPE!!![/b][/size]
iv found a great use for it, go to school/work
open paint and record it writing your name and pressing new, then set it to infinity
thanks to Ron for letting me us his "MinimiseSCAR" procedure (that reminds me, i should ask him first :P)
Version 2 is now out! For the record, version 1 was downloaded 9 times

item.title: GhostMouse
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“Blapmanjr, post:7, topic:18497”]why not use for runescape?
…all the things that Ron said, but also the Runescape screen shifts a little bit, if you look closely you might notice it moving a pixel at a time around. this means that the same co-ordinate in on different places.[/quote][quote=“Ron, post:8, topic:18497”]Good for improving on mouse movements too. :)[/quote]
i accutally made it first when i was researching mouse movements, i made loads of people move the mouse around in a line and played it back to see how well it compaired to Benmouse.

Read full topic

item.title: GhostMouse
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Yakman!!! Nice script!

Good for improving on mouse movements too.

Blapmanjr:

why not use for runescape?

Because it’s easy to recognize the same pattern over and over again. And if you do that, then RuneScape will instantly pick up on it and ban you. There is no way that you will click on 50 different coordinates at the same point without using a program. That’s why.

Read full topic

@yakman wrote:

Version 2 is out!

Improved Forms

An Option of recording your movements into a TMouseArray
Copy it into the script and use it anytime!

I’d like to take this chance to thank Mad Cow for his GREAT form tutorial ;D

item.title: GhostMouse
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Weibs:

EDIT: Only worked the first time. After that it just started at the left side of the screen and moved up and down.

WFT?!

well it records your mouse movements into an array similar to TPointArray

it plays them back in exactly the same way

i dont know whats wrong, but i used this script a lot, a lot more than twice, it never crashed

today at school, i made it write my name and set it to infinity, Very Funny to see peoples reactions ;D :rolleyes:

Read full topic
